title: Touch And Go: NASA Samples An Asteroid
description:
A NASA spacecraft sent out to collect a sample of rock and dust from an asteroid has nabbed so much that it's created an unexpected problem. NPR science correspondent Nell Greenfieldboyce shares a cautionary tale of a scientific mission that was almost too successful.

For additional info and fun links, check out the episode page.

Follow Maddie and Nell on Twitter. Maddie's @maddie_sofia and Nell's @nell_sci_NPR. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.
copyright: Copyright 2019-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Touch And Go: NASA Samples An Asteroid
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: A cautionary tale about wanting something really badly, and getting what you want. Then, realizing that you got so much of the precious thing that you might just end up losing it.
itunes:subtitle: A cautionary tale about wanting something really badly, and getting what you want. Then, realizing that you got so much of the precious thing that you might just end up losing it.
